explanation: embarrassed
sentence: He said nothing but looked abashed.
sentence_gap: He said nothing but looked _______.

explanation: formal; terrible and without hope; without any pride or respect for yourself
sentence: They live in abject poverty.

explanation: to make a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing details and information that is not important

sentence_gap: She has been asked to _______ the movie for television.

explanation: formal; (especially in religion or law) to free someone from guilt, blame, or responsibility for something
sentence: I absolve you from all your sins.

sentence: We have abundant evidence to prove his guilt.
sentence_gap: We have ________ evidence to prove his guilt.

explanation: very serious or severe; intelligent and quick to notice and understand things

explanation: to increase the size or effect of something; to make something louder

explanation: to surprise or shock someone very much
sentence: The news astounded me.
sentence_gap: The news _________ me.

explanation: formal; to make something less or weaker
sentence: Radiation from the sun is attenuated by the earth's atmosphere.

sentence: Most of the job losses will come through attrition.
sentence_gap: Most of the job losses will come through _________.

explanation: unable to produce plants or fruit

explanation: informal

sentence: A man in the street was selling bags of roast chestnuts.

explanation: deserving to be blamed or considered responsible for something bad

explanation: a pipe for waste water that crosses under roads, railways, etc.

sentence: We woke at dawn.

explanation: to represent or mean something

explanation: the state of a place that is empty or where everything has been destroyed

explanation: literary; enjoying immoral activities and not caring about behaving in a morally acceptable way

explanation: to cause something or someone to change direction
sentence: Traffic will be diverted through the side streets while the main road is resurfaced.

explanation: a thick mixture of flour and liquid used to make foods such as bread or pastry
sentence: She kneaded the dough and left it to rise.
sentence_gap: She kneaded the _____ and left it to rise.

explanation: a teaching method in which students repeat something several times to help them learn it

sentence: Tomorrow will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle.

sentence_gap: Mineral water may be ____________ due to contained gases.

translated: zwolnienie (np. podatkowe lub z jakiegoś ograniczenia)

explanation: in or coming from a place outside the planet Earth

sentence: He deals with subjects more fainthearted filmmakers would stay away from.

explanation: the part of a room that surrounds a fireplace

explanation: a sudden, short period of activity, interest, or excitement
sentence: Her arrival caused a flurry of excitement.

explanation: a person who has sex with someone who they are not married to

explanation: to meet someone socially, especially someone who belongs to an opposing army or team, or has a different social position
sentence: The soldiers were accused of fraternizing with the enemy.

sentence: This wine has a delicious fruity flavour.

explanation: a person who is running away or hiding from the police or a dangerous situation

explanation: (of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing

explanation: to collect something, usually after much work or with difficulty

sentence_gap: All the information that we ________ has been kept on file.

sentence: These glaciers are described in a single chapter.

explanation: to prepare someone carefully for a special position or job

explanation: formal; to repeatedly demand something from someone, often causing them to feel worried or angry

explanation: to make a short loud high sound

explanation: wanting to discover as much as you can about things, sometimes in a way that annoys people
sentence: She could see inquisitive faces looking out from the windows next door.

explanation: one of the parts of your finger where it bends
sentence: Charlotte rapped on the window with her knuckles.

explanation: a small piece of metal on a door that you move down so that the door will stay closed
sentence: He lifted the latch and opened the door.

explanation: present but needing particular conditions to become active, obvious, or completely developed
sentence: We're trying to bring out the latent artistic talents that many people possess without realizing it.
sentence_gap: We're trying to bring out the ______ artistic talents that many people possess without realizing it.

explanation: someone who is not trained in or does not have a detailed knowledge of a particular subject

explanation: a person who likes to do things on their own without other people
sentence: He was always a loner at school.

explanation: to move in a way that is not regular or normal, especially making sudden movements backwards or forwards or from side to side
sentence: The train lurched forward and some of the people standing fell over.

explanation: medyczne określenie
sentence: Mastication is the action of chewing food.

explanation: to tie a boat so that it stays in the same place
sentence: We moored the boat to a large tree root.

explanation: literary
sentence: They arranged to meet on the morrow.
sentence_gap: They arranged to meet on the ______.

explanation: very ordinary and therefore not interesting

sentence: She kissed the nape of his neck.
sentence_gap: She kissed the ____ of his neck.

explanation: to become involved with or take part in something

explanation: formal
sentence: Ageism is equally as offensive and pernicious as sexism.

explanation: to sell or to work regularly at something, especially at a job that involves selling things

sentence: Their decision was based on ignorance and prejudice.

explanation: formal; completely unreasonable and ridiculous; not to be believed

sentence_gap: It was a ____________ idea, and no one took it seriously.

explanation: existing very commonly or happening often
sentence: These diseases are more prevalent among young children.

sentence: Our rapacity is destroying species at a rate not seen in 65 million years.

explanation: formal; to speak angrily to someone because you disapprove of what they have said or done

explanation: formal; determined in character, action, or ideas

explanation: the income that a government or company receives regularly
sentence: Taxes provide most of the government's revenue.

explanation: making people feel excited and proud or ready to take action

explanation: a small piece of something or a small amount of information

explanation: having suddenly started to like or love something or someone very much

explanation: difficulties or pain

sentence: We lost a few tiles in the storm.

explanation: details or information that are not important

sentence_gap: The tunnel goes right __________ the city.

explanation: not clearly expressed, known, described, or decided

sentence_gap: She made a ______ reference to his past mistakes.

explanation: energetic, exciting, and full of enthusiasm

sentence: His parents are very well-off.

explanation: to increase your desire for or interest in something

sentence_gap: The book will ____ your appetite for more of her work.

explanation: unusual and strange in a way that might be funny or annoying

explanation: to become weak and dry and decay
